items.title: Christmas
items.summary: Christmas was pretty fun. On Christmas evening (December 24th) We went to Denise's parents in Waterloo. The drive was easy and we got there in time for dinner. Her aunt Shirley joined us. We had dinner and had some laughs about the kids in the…
items.content_html:
Christmas was pretty fun. On Christmas evening (December 24th) We went to Denise's parents in Waterloo. The drive was easy and we got there in time for dinner. Her aunt Shirley joined us. We had dinner and had some laughs about the kids in the family (Denise's cousins and their kids). After dinner we opened the presents. There were SO many presents, it was a really luxurious Christmas! This took some time, after which Shirley left and we just went to sleep.

On the 25th (Christmas day) I drove over to Mike's place. I spent the day there doing nothing pretty much, just chatting, helping with dinner etc. As every year, Mike's grandparents came over in the afternoon to do the presents and his cousin and uncle and aunt joined later on for dinner. His mom (Helen) is a great cook, it was delicious. We talked some politics (of course) and had some drinks and after cleaning played some games.

The 26th I drove back to Waterloo. We went over to Denise's aunt Mary for the afternoon where we met with her cousins and their kids, had food and played some games. Of course, there was some presents opening! Afterward we went to Irene and Bob, those are family friends of Denises parents and herself. We usually go there during the holidays. We exchanged presents, as usual, followed by food and a poker game. Denise and I didn't get far in the poker, which is ok since we won the last three games we played with them in the past. From there we head home again where Denise's mom and I watched some hockey before falling asleep.

The 27th (Sunday) Audrey and Hector (Denise's parents) went to church early on and we slept in. At around 12:00 we went to visit Sunny and Pam. This is one of the moms of Denise's friends Gilian (who is in Buenos Aires right now) and Garth (who is in Thailand right now). It is a complicated story, but basically, back some 30+ years ago, Shirley and Sunny were a couple living together. They had Gillian and Garth and later on in life they split up. Sunny now lives with Pam and Shirley now lives with Fritz. So we went visiting both, Sunny first and Shirley second. In between we stopped at Denise's aunt Mary again to give her their present because we forgot it the day before. It was nice since we actually had some time to chat which we couldn't when it was all busy the day before.

After all this visiting and eating we went back to Denise's parents place where I showed her mom a few things about her computer and we drove back home. I wanted to get home the same day even though it was late. The way home was fine but Denise gets nervous when it is night and there is some snow of the roads. So she was reading one of the books she got for me to distract her and at some point she started reading it out loud for me which made the drive go by really fast. It is an interesting book called "the 4 hour workweek" which I really want Danny to read.

When we got home we un-packed all the presents. Here is the mountain of presents:

OK, that's it for now.

Hugs,

Yoav

items.title: Winter affairs
items.summary: There is an island in the lake in front of Toronto called Toronto island: [googlemaps http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&amp;source=s_q&amp;hl=en&amp;geocode=&amp;q=&amp;sll=43.6257,-79.377937&amp;sspn=0.030816,0.077162&amp;ie=UTF8&amp;ll=43.6257,-79.377937&amp;spn=0.030816,0.077162&amp;z=14&amp;output=embed&w=425&h=350] There is a nice park and some beaches there where people go in the summer but there is also a residential area with a little community living there. You…
items.content_html:
There is an island in the lake in front of Toronto called Toronto island:

[googlemaps http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&geocode=&q=&sll=43.6257,-79.377937&sspn=0.030816,0.077162&ie=UTF8&ll=43.6257,-79.377937&spn=0.030816,0.077162&z=14&output=embed&w=425&h=350]

There is a nice park and some beaches there where people go in the summer but there is also a residential area with a little community living there. You need to take the ferry and there are no cars allowed, so it is a really cute area which doesn't feel like being in the city. My friend Helen (who is from New Zealand) lives there with her boyfriend Pete. They are visitig New Zealand now for the Christmas holidays and she asked me to check the house sometimes and water the plants. Last weekend I went over with Denise, Dave, Laura and two of Denises friends from work, Kirstan and Beth. we spent the day over there, drinking hot chocolate and wine and eating cheese and snacks like pigs and playing some games. It was a nice day out of the city, like a little adventure. Denise and I spent the night over which was nice, a little vacation away but still close.

On Sunday last week we went to see some hockey. Laura (Dave's girlfriend) got some tickets to go see the second-level Toronto team. They had a practice by the first team followed by the game so we went to see both. Denise's friend Harry joined us instead of Denise because she doesn't like hockey. It was great seeing some live hockey. The team that practiced first is the main Toronto team, a very famous team. Toward the end of the practice they got a local kids team to come on the ice and practice with the real players. It was SO cute! Those really big hockey players were playing along with the little kids, passing the puck and pushing each other.

Hanukah was fun this year! we lit the candles every night and even had some friends over some times. We lit one night at the island with everyone and with Ben and Janice once (they came over for dinner on Wednesday). We have the fireplace on quite often now as it is getting cold (Mom, you would LOVE the fireplace, it is really old and very nice, made of heavy metal). Temperatures are constantly below 0 these days but no snow still.

As you know, Christmas is coming up and with it is the crazy plans (well, crazy presents more so than plans). I plan to go to Denises parents place for the 24th evening, when we do all the presents opening etc, spend the night over and probably go over to Mikes place for the 25th, where they do the presents during the day. Spend the day there, which is usually very relaxing and fun and head over back to Waterloo (where Denise's family lives) for the 26th and 27th, where we have plans to meet up with friends and family. Here are some pictures of the crazy present wrapping. This was an expensive Christmas for me! :-)

What else? Nothing more. Denise is away at a Christmas party at Waterloo tonight and I stayed home because I need to work. Instead, I am at a pub having some chicken wings, beer and writing this post. I plan to wake up early tomorrow, have a quick breakfast and head over to the lab to work.

Until next time,

Hugs,

Yoav

items.title: Hanukah update
items.summary: Well, there re quite a few things to update about! Where shall I start? First, winter is here. Temperature got down to -10 or so, a little bit of snow but lots of ice. It is getting nice to be inside in the evening with…
items.content_html:
Well, there re quite a few things to update about!

Where shall I start?

First, winter is here. Temperature got down to -10 or so, a little bit of snow but lots of ice. It is getting nice to be inside in the evening with the fire place on.

Last Saturday I went to a bar-mitzvah. Someone from Suzans side, the connection is complicated. It was really nice, synagogue in the morning, followed by lunch. Unfortunately, Denise couldn’t join because she was at work.

In the evening Denise and I went to see a musical. It was great! Really funny with great music. It is called “The Toxic Avenger” and it is based on a really bad movie from the 80’s. It was in the Greek part of the city so we went for some Greek food afterward.

I added a picture of us with the fireplace going. It is kind of nice to have it going, very cozy. I know you would have liked it, but it is a tradeoff between the weather being very cold outside so we can have a nice fire inside.

As you know, it is Hanukah. I found some candles form last year but Denise got a new package as well as some SVIVONIM, with a little package of cards with questions about Hanukah. We lit the candles and had some dinner. It is nice to have the Hanukiya by the window and the fireplace going.

We have a nice weekend coming up, I will write more about it Sunday night.

items.title: Thanksgiving
items.summary: OK, again, it has been a long time since I've updated... So, what is new? About a month ago Denise's friend Laurie came for a visit with her boyfriend Rob. They live in Portland, Oregon (see where it is here ). They came during Thanksgiving…
items.content_html:
OK, again, it has been a long time since I've updated...

So, what is new?

About a month ago Denise's friend Laurie came for a visit with her boyfriend Rob. They live in Portland, Oregon (see where it is here ). They came during Thanksgiving weekend (October 10th), which is on a different date in Canada and in the US. Also, Oktoberfest is taking place on the same weekend (and the whole week) in Waterloo (the city where Denise grew up). It is German festival of drinking pretty much.

They arrived on Friday and stayed until Monday, short but sweet. We spent some really nice time together in Toronto. Went for some nice walks to the market and around the city, to the Island (Denise went for the first time) and spent time at home playing games, eating good cheeses and drinking wine.

On Saturday afternoon Denise and I drove to Waterloo to have thanksgiving dinner with Denise's family, after which we went to one of the Oktoberfest events. It was full of very young people with very long lines. We were supposed to meet one of Denise's friends there but she enver showed up, so after about two hours we head back to her parents and went to bed.

Sunday we woke up early and drove back to Toronto in time for brunch with Laurie and Rob.

Rob is a lobbyist for union, which means he tries to promote agendas on behalf of the union. It was really interesting talking politics with him, I hope to go visit in Portland and see the process in action.

What else? Denise and I are very interested in Social Innovation these days. I will leave it to Denise to describe soon. But we go to a lecture series about entrepreneurship (“YAZAMUT” in Hebrew) and are interested in the social side of things.

My defense date will probably be in January. I am a little bit scared about what I'm going to do afterward. I just don't feel like much right now.

Last weekend was Halloween. We went to a concert on Friday night with some friends. It is actually a show, a really interesting one, Denise's favourite! It is hard to explain what it is about actually. It is called “Hedwig and the Angry Inch” and it is about a boy who wants to leave East Germany so he goes through a sex change operation to get married, then becomes a rock star etc. It is a weird show.

I hope Denise will write about it soon.

Hugs,

Yoav

items.title: T-shirts and movies
items.summary: OK, First post since we got back from the states. Not much excitement since, but a few things we did. Last weekend we had some of our climbing friends over for T-shirt making party! We have been talking about having our own little climbing club,…
items.content_html:
OK,

First post since we got back from the states. Not much excitement since, but a few things we did.

Last weekend we had some of our climbing friends over for T-shirt making party! We have been talking about having our own little climbing club, secret society. We are calling it "The Fine Line" because when you climb, the route you do is called "a line", the way the rock goes. And "fine" means something pretty. Also, to walk a lone may mean to balance different things, which is a lot like climbing. So, the fine line, or team fine line. I prefer "The Fine Line". Anyway, our friend Janice have been making t-shirts prints for some time now, it is pretty easy but we never did it before. So finally, after long waiting and much organization we got together at our place. We had Dave, Jess, Ben, Janice, Denise and myself. Janice explained how to the process goes and we all got into work. Basically, you draw what you want to have on the t-shirt. Then you copy it onto a plastic sheet, then you cut the plastic along your design so you have a stencil. once this is ready, you glue it to the shirt using a special spray and then you put your paint over the stencil and you have your print! Last step is to heat the shirt up so that the paint "sets" and becomes a part of the fabric. Voila! Your own shirt!

So on we went. Dave decided to skip the whole process and just free-hand draw on the shirt with a paintbrush. He did great job at it! Janice draw fast and furious while Ben, Jess and I were looking at climbing magazines for some inspiring pictures. Denise were drawing in the room.

Ben finally found his ideal climber and drew it on but Jess and I were clueless, we are the least artistic in the gang and it took us a while to get our fingers moving with the pencil. Janice was almost done by the time I just started. Anyway, drawing was hard but cutting the plastic proved to be an easier task for me. Denise had a good drawing (the best of all in my opinion) but had a hard time with the cutting. I had to help her out.

Anyway, long story short, we all have our shirts. We didn't take a group picture yet but I got a few of Denise and I.

Also, this week (today) the Toronto International Film Festival (TIFF) started. We went to see one Canadian movie which was pretty good. They started a new program this year called "city to city" in which they choose a city around the world to have a focus on their movies. This year, the first year, they chose Tel-Aviv! Of course, the usual "controversy" around putting Israel in focus started with a letter by some artists saying they don't want to participate in a festival that supports "Israeli apartheid" etc etc. It is getting ridiculous but also scary to what level the Palestinians are organized.

Anyway, we are going to see one of the Tel-Aviv movie next week. I will write about it afterward.

items.title: Pride and farm
items.summary: With a week's delay I want to write about last weekend, Pride Parade. It was pride week in Toronto, the week celebrating Gay rights and culture, which ends with the Parade, one of the largest in the world. We now live in the heart of…
items.content_html:
With a week's delay I want to write about last weekend, Pride Parade. It was pride week in Toronto, the week celebrating Gay rights and culture, which ends with the Parade, one of the largest in the world. We now live in the heart of the gay neghbourhood and it is where all the action was.

On Saturday, as a preparation, Denise's friend Elizabeth came over and they made cup-cakes colored in all the rainbow colors. I colored mine with stars and hearts to make it pretty. We planned on serving those to our landlord who invited us over for Sunday.

On Sunday the streets were closed, there were stages and booths and music everywhere. Unfortunately, it was raining, but it stopped toward the afternoon. We invited all our friends to stop over in case they are in the area and an old acquaintance of us, Marla Gold, whom we met once (long story) but a year later started working with Denise, came over early on. We had some food, made sangria, and went out to watch the parade with the sangria in a bottle. We met up with Marla's brother (Jason) and her new date on the street and watched the end of the parade, at which point Avital joined us and we all head back to our place to hang out with our landlord for a little while. We ended up in our back yard, all of us plus a couple friends of Marla's brother and their baby. We drank sangria, avital played the guitar and we all sang, it was great! We never met those people before yet we felt a good connection. We love having new people over!

I don't have the pictures here, but Avital's pictures can found if you click here. When you click it will open a new window, just click on the pictures and they will get bigger, and you will have arrow above the the picture to see the next one of the previous one. He has a couple of pictures of Denise and I (and the cup-cakes) there.

The week went by and this weekend Mike was visiting his parents so he came over on Saturday. It was good seeinghim after so long, we went for lunch, Him, Denise, Elizabeth and Mike's friend Britny. It was good catching up and we played some catch afterward (which is just throwing a baseball to each other), appropriate game for catching up! He had to leave early and we had a busy day Sunday so we had an early night.

Today we went to work in the farm. One of Denise's best friend, Daniel, is an organic farmer ad on Sundays he has volunteers coming to help him out with whatever need getting done in the farm. Today we mostly weeded out the different areas, nothing too exciting. He usually "pays" the volunteers with food, which is nice. Maxim and LisBeth came with the kids but were there really late, so we stayed after everyone left to do some work and then went to their place for lunch, which ended up being a lot of fun, Denise and Lisbeth played Barbie with Rene (the girl) while the boys played computer games. Not much happaned after, we just drove home, I was really really tired but now I am not falling asleep.

I don't really feel writing about my mood, work etc since we speak about on the phone, but today it is a bit better. Denise and I had a long chat on the way home about the future, the complication etc and I think we are quite confident with each other. It won't be easy working a future for us together but we plan on going through it. She certainly keeps me afloat this time of my life which is not easy.

That's it for now!

items.title: Moving, Denise's birthday
items.summary: OK, it (again) has been a long time since I've wrote. My best excuse is that I had a hard time getting the internet set up here but I can always write from work. Anyway, as you know, we moved on June 1st. Our new…
items.content_html:
OK, it (again) has been a long time since I've wrote. My best excuse is that I had a hard time getting the internet set up here but I can always write from work.

Anyway, as you know, we moved on June 1st. Our new place is quite nice, it a one-bedroom apartment on the ground floor of a house: one bedroom, one nice living room, laundry in the basement, nice big kitchen, a little sun-room and a little garden. We obviously went planting immediately, some morning glories, sage (MARVA) mint, begonias, basil, thyme, rosemary, lemongrass and some more. This was fun until the squirrels started digging everything up and slashing the plants for no reason. They seem to really like this area because they are everywhere! Denise even caught one on camera while doing it. I was a bit mad at them and went on to set some traps but Denise violently objected and we had to surrender. Well, I guess. I still hate them but I'm not doing anything to harm them, just let them be and ruin my garden without retaliation. Here are some pictures of the garden before the squirrel-attack:

Our landlords are a gay couple Frank and Franco. We live in the Village, or the gay neighborhood, in Toronto. It is a little strip of a few blocks where the gay community is very prominent. We moved here because the place is nice and close (oh, we also have a private parking spot which is a nice bonus in Toronto) but also because we wanted to try a new neighborhood. It is very comfortable here, many convenient stores, coffee shops etc within one-two minutes walk (which we didn't have before).

The move itself was not that bad. It was hard to combine all our stuff, we have too many things! We tried to give away whatever we didn't need but we still have a lot. Moving it was easy though, as the place was empty and we moved it a bit at a time. A  pictures packing won't hurt. Take a good look, this is the last of Trinity!

So what happaned over the last two weeks... Hmmm... I'm trying to finish writing my thesis. It is going very slow because I can't sit my self down and simply do it. I really don't like it by now and I find out how little I really learned over the last three years. But I don't really want to dwell on it too much right now. I've also started running. Denise has been following this program for a few weeks now and a few people in the lab are training for a half-marathon, so I decided to try as well. I really don't enjoy running all that much I have to say! But it's going ok. We'll see how long I survive.

Denise's birthday was on Monday. We had a BBQ for friends on Sunday which was good, it was a gorgeous day, sunny, not too hot and perfect for a BBQ. Unfortunately, our garden is not that big so there wasn't much space for people but it was fine. A friend of Denise, Maxim came with his wife Elizabeth and two kids. The kids were extremely cute and well behaved, played with each other and kept themselves busy. Elizabeth brought her guitar and towards the end, when most people left, she played and sang along with my friend Avital. He played some old Israeli songs for us which made me even more homesick than usual. Some pictures:

Oh! Before that, on Friday we were at Dani and Debbie for kidush. We celebrated 1) Aviva graduating from university 2) Tricia (Debbies sister) graduating from Teacher's college 3) Tricia's second marriage 4) Zuza's birthday 5) Debbies step-father birthday and 6) Denise's birthday. Needless to say, it was a full house with lots of food and fun! I don't have pictures yet but I will hopefully get some soon.

I've also had my first baseball practice Tuesday. It was fun, but I think there are to many people on the team which means every individual won't get to play much since only about 9 people are on the field at any moment. We'll see.

OK. It is Saturday noon now and Denise's parents are coming for lunch so I going to clean up a bit.

items.title: Science Rendezvous
items.summary: Hi, Sorry for not writing for so long. I want to tell you about last weekend. It was Science Rendezvous weekend in Toronto. It is a day in which different scientific institutions, including universities and hospitals, open their doors to the public to talk about…
items.content_html:
Hi,

Sorry for not writing for so long. I want to tell you about last weekend. It was Science Rendezvous weekend in Toronto. It is a day in which different scientific institutions, including universities and hospitals, open their doors to the public to talk about science. There were also meetings in coffee shops and pubs where scientists had open conversations about it. I volunteered with the hospital to put a presentation of what we do in the lab. Dave and JP (our technician) helped out and we set up two microscopes to let people look at cells. It was a fun experience to go through the planning and the whole process leading to it, there is so much happening behind the scenes!

Here is a picture:

Other than that, we are mostly busy with looking for a place to move into. We want a yard or a patio where we can grow plants and have a BBQ, so we are pretty selective. Also, we were a little bit concerned with signing up for a full year because Denise is considering buying a house and we didn't want to have to wait because it is a good time for that. I think we will move into a place soon. I hope so, I want to have the BBQ!

We had some windy cold days here again. However, all the trees are in bloom which is beautiful!  Last week on the way to work we walked by this little plaza at the entrance to a building. The wind was blowing really hard and blew the pink flowers off the tree, it was gorgeous!

Also recently Denise started a class in her hospital called Nia, it is an excercise class which is a little bit of dance, yoga (?) and martial arts. She will write more about it. It is on Wednesdays from 17:00-18:00 and she seems to like it. The funny thing is that about a year ago we went for dinner with Tricia (Debbie's sister) and her boyfriend at the time and some of his friends came along, where we met this lady, Marla, who we both liked and had a good time with. I remember she told me she was a Nia instructor and invited us to try. We never saw her again, but she is the one doing the classes in the hospital so we might go out wiht her soon. Small world! Last week her hospital had a the nursing week and she had a booth to promote the healthy workplace program. Here she is:

Last night I went to see a play in the theater, Doubt. There was a movie based on it recently. The plot is set in a church school. The principal (a nun) suspects the priest to sexully abuse one of the kids. It is never said but is suggested based on the conversations. She has no proof of it but she is still convinced. The play revolves around the (un)certainty and walks the line between personal conviction, when we believe someone, when we doubt, the demange that can done etc. It was excellent and I recommnad watching the movie.

Other then that, tomorrow we are finally going climbing outdoors for the first time this year, so I should go to bed and get some sleep!

items.title: Wedding weekend
items.summary: Hi, This last weekend we went to Chatham, a town about 4 hours drive west of Toronto, for a wedding. Bryan, a post-oc in the lab got married to Amanda. You can see on this map below where it is. The wedding was nice. We…
items.content_html:
Hi,

This last weekend we went to Chatham, a town about 4 hours drive west of Toronto, for a wedding. Bryan, a post-oc in the lab got married to Amanda. You can see on this map below where it is.

The wedding was nice. We don't hae any pictures from the actual wedding. It was fun to have all the people from the lab together with ther wives/girlfriends. We always hear about the other part of everyone but rarely meet them, so it was nice to get this time together.

We drove with Jonathan and Greg, two people from the lab. The drive was fun and we found the chuch easily. Chatham is a small, rural, boring town. It is very spread out and is the center of south-western Ontario, in the middle of a lot of farms.

After the church ceremony we went to the hotel, got our rooms and got some drinks. We played some games and got ready to go to the dinner. At 17:30 we took cabs to where the dinner and dancing was, found our spots and had more drinks, food and some dancing, before taking cabs back and going to sleep.

The morning after Denise and I decided we want to stop somewhere on the way. We found a place called Rondeau which has a national park and decided to go see it. It is a very nice park, with swamp, forest and beach, all in the same park. We went on two hikes, saw a lot of birds and a turtle. Apparently it is a very important place for birds and many bird-watchers come there to see them.

After the park we drove to another little town, about 500 people to get some food and found this restaurant which supose to have good fish. The fish wasn't that good but the place was very charming. From there we head back home, stopping on the way for some ice vream.

Here are some pictures and the map:[googlemaps http://maps.google.com/maps/ms?ie=UTF8&msa=0&ll=42.428525,-81.953888&spn=0.557509,0.836334&msid=114720577100417615715.00046936df7cf1f9c26fd&output=embed&w=425&h=350]

items.title: Clean Up!
items.summary: Last Saturday, spring visited us for one wonderful day. We celebrated by helping to clean-up trash and broken bottles from our local outdoor climbing location, Rattlesnake Point. The location we helped to clean had very little trash, but it had a lot of broken glass…
items.content_html:
Last Saturday, spring visited us for one wonderful day.  We celebrated by helping to clean-up trash and broken bottles from our local outdoor climbing location, Rattlesnake Point.  The location we helped to clean had very little trash, but it had a lot of broken glass which needed to be picked up.  This is because teenagers go to the parking lot above to drink and then throw their empty beer bottles over the edge of the cliff.  Luckily we had gloves so picking up glass was easy.  We had a wonderful morning with lots of other climbers, and a general community spirit:

Looking forward to more beautiful weather soon.  After such a long winter and windy, rainy, cold spring, some sun and warmth will be a blessing.

Habuk ve neshikot,

Denise
